title: ‘A Man Walks Into a Barn’ Review: Ticket to Ride
sub_head: One lawyer’s witty, often wistful take on fatherhood, family ﬁnances and the tony, insular world of horses and ‘horse people.’
body:
Books about fathers and sons are fairly common, books about fathers and their daughters somewhat less so. A book about a father, three daughters, several horses, social demographics, and the teaching and practice of both law and riding must surely belong to a genre of one.
Chad Oldfather is a professor at Marquette University Law School in Milwaukee and the father of three horse-crazy girls (now grown). “A Man Walks Into a Barn” is his witty, often wistful take on parenting, pedagogy, and life lessons learned while navigating the insular and expensive world of horses and “horse people.”
